intro: Jurinea sharifiana var. aziziana, commonly known as the Azizian sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia, particularly found in countries like Afghanistan and Pakistan. This perennial herb is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with small, fleshy leaves adapted to conserve water. The plant produces clusters of small, pink or white flowers during the spring and summer months. Its botanical features make it well-suited for harsh environments, showcasing remarkable resilience to drought and extreme temperatures.
